summary: Many people have trouble tracking their 401(k) accounts when they change jobs. After separating from an employer, plan participants are sent a 402(f) notice that has some information on distribution options—like rolling over funds—and the tax consequences of cashing out funds from old plans. But only about a third of participants received this notice before they decided what to do with their retirement savings. About...
title: 401(k) Retirement Plan Tax Notices: Federal Actions Can Help Participants Understand Their Distribution Options
